sentences.english: Caesar was the general of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 愷撒是羅馬的蓋世將軍。

sentences.english: There were times when the Germans became suspicious, and she was even interviewed by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 德國人有時起疑，蓋世太保甚至找她問話。

sentences.english: Instead, Rabe was arrested by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 不料蓋世太保反而把拉伯拘捕。

sentences.english: You mean you want me to beat up Jews with my truncheon and catch the Gestapo spirit.
sentences.chinese: 你的意思是想讓我和蓋世太保一樣用警棍毆打猶太人。

sentences.english: The Gestapo called her the “White Mouse”.
Waited for me to become the matchless hero, I will tread seven color auspicious clouds to look for you.
sentences.chinese: 等我成爲了蓋世英雄，我會踏着七彩祥雲去找你。

sentences.english: Lets that matchless hero who in her heart waited for with hardship.
sentences.chinese: 等我成爲了蓋世英雄，我會踏着七彩祥雲去找你。

sentences.english: Regina was arrested, on November 6th, by the Gestapo.
sentences.chinese: 11月6日，蓋世太保將雷吉娜逮捕。

sentences.english: In spite of the superabundance of its martial spirit, it could not escape an early death.
sentences.chinese: 它雖有蓋世的氣概，但終不能倖免於死亡。

sentences.english: Talented he, will in the imperial examinations in gun fired?
sentences.chinese: 才華蓋世的他，會在科舉考試中一炮打響嗎？

sentences.english: As a German-enlisted man, he killed 13 Gestapo officers.
sentences.chinese: 他作爲一個德國軍人，卻殺了13個蓋世太保。

sentences.english: And then the Dragon warrior joined the Furious five.
sentences.chinese: 然後神龍大俠加入了蓋世五俠。
勇氣並不總是拔山蓋世。

sentences.english: Gestapo put her arrest, locked up in a "children's health camp".
sentences.chinese: 蓋世太保把她抓起來，關進了“兒童健康營”。

sentences.english: Shortly after their marriage, Laszlo was apprehended by Gestapo[4].
sentences.chinese: 但婚後不久，拉茲洛就被蓋世太保抓走了。

sentences.english: Liu Yazi had also praised her: "She has well spirit which can lift the sky, and was unparalleled talent."
sentences.chinese: 柳亞子曾讚美她“有掀天之意氣，蓋世之才華”。

definition: to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
to talk idly about important matters (idiom)/to set the world to rights/to pass judgment on everything
